div.p: SAVIOUR, an appellation peculiarly given to Jeſus Chriſt, as being the Meſſiah and Saviour of the world. See Jesus.

Order of St SAVIOUR, a religious order of the Romiſh Church, founded by St Bridget, about the year 1345, and ſo called from its being pretended that our Saviour himſelf declared its conſtitution and rules to the foundreſs. According to the conſtitutions, this is principally founded for religious women who pay a particular honour to the holy virgin; but there are ſome monks of the order, to adminiſter the ſacrament and ſpiritual aſſiſtance to the nuns.
